ej.nls

Class NLS

  • java.lang.Object
    • ej.nls.NLS
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicImmutablesNLS

    public abstract class NLS
extends java.lang.Object
    NLS provides support for manipulating messages and languages.
    Each instance of a NLS manages a set of messages, and each message is defined by a unique int value.
    Each language is defined by a locale string. By convention, a locale represents a specific geographical, political, or cultural region. It is often represented using the concatenation of a language code and a country code:
    • The language code is the lower-case, two-letter codes as defined by ISO-639.
    • The country code is the upper-case, two-letter codes as defined by ISO-3166.

      • getMessage

        public abstract java.lang.String getMessage(int messageID)
        Gets the message matching the specified ID in the current language. The first message has an ID of 1.
        Parameters:
        messageID - the ID of the message to retrieve
        Returns:
        the message at the specified ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given messageID does not match a valid message

      • getMessage

        public abstract java.lang.String getMessage(int messageID,
                                            java.lang.String locale)
        Gets the message matching the specified ID in the language of the specified locale. The first message has an ID of 1.
        Parameters:
        messageID - the ID of the message to retrieve
        locale - the locale to use
        Returns:
        the message at the specified ID
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given messageID does not match a valid message
